draft_translation: Oberhof: Kühn Achter in the World Championship Sprint
final_translation: Oberhof: Kühn Achter in the World Championship Sprint

src: Bö setzte seine beeindruckende Serie trotz schwieriger Bedingungen fort und gewann auch das sechste Sprintrennen der Saison. Der fünfmalige Olympiasieger hat nun schon 14 WM-Titel gesammelt und schließt weiter zu seinem Landsmann Ole Einar Björndalen auf. Die Biathlon-Ikone, die als TV-Experte vor Ort ist, ist mit 20 WM-Goldmedaillen noch unangefochtener Rekordchampion. Auch teilweise starker Nebel hinderte Dauersieger Bö nicht daran, schon sein zweites Gold am Rennsteig einzusammeln. Am Mittwoch hatte es mit Norwegens Mixed-Staffel schon zur erfolgreichen Titelverteidigung gereicht.
ref: Bö continued his impressive run despite challenging conditions and also won the sixth sprint race of the season. The five-time Olympic champion has now won 14 World Cup titles and is closing in on his compatriot Ole Einar Björndalen. The biathlon icon, who is attending the event as a TV expert, is the uncontested recordholder with 20 World Cup gold medals. Even the fog, which was sometimes dense, did not prevent Bö from continuing his winning streak and earning his second gold medal on the racetrack. The mixed Norwegian team had already successfully defended its title on Wednesday.
draft_translation: Bö continued his impressive series despite difficult conditions and also won his sixth sprint race of the season. The five-time Olympic champion now has already collected 14 World Championship titles and is now level with his countryman Ole Einar Björndalen. The biathlon icon, who is on site as a TV expert, has already accumulated 20 World Championship gold medals and remains the undisputed record holder. Even partly strong fog could not prevent the consistent winner Bö from securing his second gold at the Rennsteig. On Wednesday, it had already been sufficient for Norway's mixed relay to achieve a successful title defense.
final_translation: Bö continued his impressive series despite difficult conditions and also won his sixth sprint race of the season. The five-time Olympic champion has now collected 14 World Championship titles and is now on par with his countryman Ole Einar Björndalen. The biathlon icon, who is on site as a TV expert, has already accumulated 20 World Championship gold medals and remains the undisputed record holder. Even partly heavy fog could not prevent the consistent winner Bö from securing his second gold at the Rennsteig. On Wednesday, it was sufficient for Norway's mixed relay team to achieve a successful title defense.

src: Kaum jemand zweifelt daran, dass im Jagdrennen Nummer drei folgen wird. In der Verfolgung ist Bö einmal mehr der klare Favorit. Seine Laufform ist überragend, sodass er Schießfehler bis zu einem gewissen Maß erschreckend einfach kompensieren kann.
ref: Hardly anyone doubts that number three will follow during the cross-country skiing. Bö is once again the obvious favorite in the race. His skiing form is exceptional, meaning that he is surprisingly easily capable of compensating for shooting errors to a certain extent.
draft_translation: Few doubt that number three will follow in the hunting race. In the pursuit, Bö is once again the clear favorite. His running form is outstanding, allowing him to compensate for shooting errors to a certain extent.
final_translation: Few doubt that number three will finish third in the hunting competition. In the pursuit, Bö is once again the clear favorite. His running form is outstanding, allowing him to compensate for shooting errors to a certain extent.

src: Bei Doll lief derweil schon wieder nichts zusammen. Nachdem der Routinier mit einer Strafrunde in der Mixed-Staffel alle Chancen auf eine Medaille zum Auftakt vergeben hatte und es nur Platz sechs gegeben hatte, lief es drei Tage später nicht besser. Drei Strafrunden schon im Liegendschießen und zwei weitere stehend waren eine große Enttäuschung für den Ältesten im deutschen Team, der 2017 den größten Erfolg seiner Laufbahn in dieser Disziplin gefeiert hatte.
ref: Nothing went right for Doll again. After the veteran lost all hope of a medal in the mixed relay due to a penalty round at the very start and finished only sixth, things did not go any better three days later. He already racked up three penalties during prone shooting and two more during standing shooting were a major disappointment for the oldest member of the German team, who celebrated the greatest success of his career in this sport in 2017.
draft_translation: Meanwhile, things had gone wrong again for Doll. After the routine member had handed over all chances of winning a medal in the mixed relay at the start with a penalty round, and only sixth place had been achieved, things didn't improve three days later. Three penalty rounds already in the prone shooting and two more standing were a great disappointment for the oldest member of the German team, who had celebrated his biggest success in this discipline in 2017.
final_translation: Meanwhile, things had gone wrong again for Doll. After the routine member had handed over all chances of winning a medal in the mixed relay at the start with a penalty round, and only sixth place had been achieved, things didn't improve three days later. Three penalty rounds already in the prone shooting and two more standing were a great disappointment for the oldest member of the German team, who had celebrated his biggest success in this discipline in 2017.

src: In Hochfilzen gewann er vor sechs Jahren überraschend mit 0,7 Sekunden Vorsprung hauchdünn vor Bö. Es war einer von insgesamt nur drei Karriereerfolgen Dolls, der in diesem Winter bislang einmal auf dem Podest stand. Der Olympia-Achte von Peking zog nach seinem schwachen Auftritt wortlos davon und gab zunächst keine Interviews. Roman Rees schaffte es auf Platz 19, der zweite WM-Debütant David Zobel belegte Rang 35.
ref: Six years ago, he surprisingly beat Bö by a narrow margin of 0.7 seconds in Hochfilzen. It was one of three career victories for Doll, who has only been on the podium once so far this winter. The eighth place finisher in the Beijing Olympics disappeared without a word after his poor performance and initially gave no interviews. Roman Rees made it to 19th place, and the second World Cup debutant David Zobel took 35th place.
draft_translation: In Hochfilzen won he six years ago surprisingly with a 0.7-second lead barely ahead of Bö. It was one of only three career successes of Doll's that so far this winter has placed him on the podium. The 8th place at the Olympics in Beijing followed his weak performance and he left silently without giving any interviews. Roman Rees reached 19th place, and the second World Championship debutant David Zobel finished in 35th place.
final_translation: In Hochfilzen he won six years ago surprisingly with a 0.7-second lead barely ahead of Bö. It was one of only three career successes of Doll's that so far this winter has placed him on the podium. The 8th place at the Olympics in Beijing followed his weak performance and he left silently without giving any interviews. Roman Rees reached 19th place, and the second World Championship debutant David Zobel finished in 35th place.

src: Biden empfängt Lula: "Müssen für Demokratie eintreten"
ref: Biden welcomes Lula: "Must stand up for democracy"
draft_translation: Biden receives Lula: "Must stand up for democracy"
final_translation: Biden meets Lula: "Must stand up for democracy"

src: Bei einem Treffen zwischen US-Präsident Joe Biden und seinem Amtskollegen aus Brasilien, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, geht es vor allem um den Wert der Demokratie. Beide blicken auf ihre Vorgänger zurück.
ref: The main focus of a meeting between U.S. President Joe Biden and his counterpart from Brazil, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, was the value of democracy. Both of them reflected on their predecessors.
draft_translation: At a meeting between US President Joe Biden and his Brazilian counterpart, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, the focus is mainly on the value of democracy. Both look back at their predecessors.
final_translation: At a meeting between US President Joe Biden and his Brazilian colleague, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, the focus is mainly on the value of democracy. Both reflect on their predecessors.

src: US-Präsident Joe Biden hat bei einem Besuch seines brasilianischen Kollegen Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva auf den Erhalt demokratischer Werte gepocht.
ref: U.S. President Joe Biden stressed the preservation of democratic values during a visit with his Brazilian counterpart Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva.
draft_translation: Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva emphasized the preservation of democratic values during his visit to US President Joe Biden.
final_translation: Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva emphasized the preservation of democratic values during his visit to US President Joe Biden.

src: "Die starke Demokratie unserer beiden Nationen wurde auf die Probe gestellt", sagte Biden am Freitag im Weißen Haus in Washington. "Wir müssen weiterhin für die Demokratie eintreten, für die demokratischen Werte, die den Kern unserer Stärke ausmachen". Lula entgegnete mit Blick auf seinen rechten Amtsvorgänger Jair Bolsonaro: "Brasilien hat sich vier Jahre lang isoliert".
ref: "The strong democracy of both of our nations is being put to the test," Biden said at the White House in Washington on Friday. "We must continue to stand up for democracy, for the democratic values that form the core of our strength,. Lula responded with reference to his right-wing presidential predecessor Jair Bolsonaro: "Brazil isolated itself for four years."
draft_translation: "The strong democracy of our two nations was put to the test," said Biden on Friday at the White House in Washington. "We must continue to stand for democracy, for the democratic values that form the core of our strength." Lula replied, looking at his right-hand predecessor Jair Bolsonaro: "Brazil has been isolated for four years."
final_translation: The strong democracy of our two nations was put to the test," said Biden on Friday at the White House in Washington. "We must continue to stand for democracy, for the democratic values that form the core of our strength." Lula replied, looking at his predecessor Jair Bolsonaro: "Brazil has been isolated for four years."

src: Der Links-Politiker Lula hatte sich Ende Oktober in einer Stichwahl gegen Bolsonaro durchgesetzt. Am 1. Januar trat Lula das Amt an. Der Machtwechsel wurde begleitet von schweren Krawallen. Anhänger Bolsonaros hatten im Januar den Kongress, den Obersten Gerichtshof und den Regierungssitz in der Hauptstadt Brasília gestürmt. Der Gewaltausbruch in Brasilien erinnert auf düstere Weise an den Sturm auf das US-Kapitol vor gut zwei Jahren, bei dem Anhänger des damaligen Präsidenten Donald Trump gewaltsam in das Parlament in Washington eindrangen.
ref: The left-wing politician Lula prevailed in a runoff election against Bolsonaro in late October. Lula took office on 1 January. The transition of power was accompanied by extreme rioting. In January, Bolsonaro's supporters stormed the Congress, the Supreme Court, and the Parliament in the capital Brasília. The outbreak of violence in Brazil was darkly reminiscent of the storming of the U.S. capital about two years ago, during which supporters of the then-President Donald Trump violently invaded Congress in Washington.
draft_translation: Lula, the left-wing politician, won the runoff election in late October against Bolsonaro. On January 1st, Lula took office. The power transfer was accompanied by severe riots. Bolsonaro's supporters stormed the Congress, the Supreme Court, and the government headquarters in the capital, Brasília, in January. The violence in Brazil eerily resembles the storming of the U.S. Capitol nearly two years ago, when Trump's supporters violently entered the parliament in Washington.
final_translation: Lula, the left-wing politician, won the runoff election in late October against Bolsonaro. On January 1st, Lula took office. The power transfer was accompanied by severe riots. Bolsonaro's supporters stormed the Congress, the Supreme Court, and the government headquarters in the capital, Brasília, in January. The violence in Brazil eerily reminiscent of the storming of the U.S. Capitol nearly two years ago, when Trump's supporters violently entered the Capitol in Washington.

src: Lula kritisierte Bolsonaro bei dem Treffen mit Biden offen. Sein Vorgänger habe nicht viel auf internationale Beziehungen gegeben. "Seine Welt begann und endete mit Fake News, morgens, nachmittags und abends", sagte Lula. "Kommt mir bekannt vor", entgegnete Biden - eine offensichtliche Anspielung auf seinen Amtsvorgänger Trump.
ref: Lula openly criticized Bolsonaro during the meeting with Biden. His predecessor did not think much of international relations. "His world started and ended with fake news, morning, afternoon and night," says Lula. "Sounds familiar," replied Biden - an obvious allusion to his predecessor Trump.
draft_translation: Lula openly criticized Bolsonaro during the meeting with Biden. His predecessor had not given much attention to international relations. "His world began and ended with fake news, in the morning, afternoon, and evening," said Lula. "That sounds familiar," replied Biden – an obvious reference to his predecessor, Trump.
final_translation: Lula openly criticized Bolsonaro during the meeting with Biden. His predecessor had not given much attention to international relations. "His world began and ended with fake news, in the morning, afternoon, and evening," said Lula. "That sounds familiar," replied Biden – an obvious reference to his predecessor, Trump.

src: Kurze Notiz über die Presse - der Freitag
ref: Short note about the press - the Friday
draft_translation: Short note on the press - Friday
final_translation: Short note on the press - Friday

src: Erinnert sich noch jemand an die RAF-Fahndungsplakate? Man sah darauf die zur Denunziation und zum Abschuss freigegebenen Mitglieder der Roten Armee Fraktion.
ref: Does anyone remember the RAF wanted posters? They showed members of the Red Army Faction who were to be denounced and shot down.
draft_translation: Does anyone still remember the RAF wanted posters? They showed members of the Red Army Faction who were released for denunciation and shooting.
final_translation: Does anyone still remember the RAF's wanted posters? They showed members of the Red Army Faction who were released for denunciation and shooting.

src: In einem Land mit Denunziationskultur, die gab es schon vor Corona, wurde so öffentlich Stimmung gemacht, gegen die gefährlichsten Gegner der BRD; sagen wir mal der bürgerlichen Demokratie, sagen wir mal der spätkapitalistischen Gesellschaft. (Hier nichts zu den wirklich Gefährlichen in Nadelstreifenanzug und Krawatte.)
ref: In a country with a culture of denunciation, which was already present before the coronavirus, this was how an atmosphere targeting the most dangerous opponents of the Federal Republic of Germany was created; you can call it civil democracy, you can call it late-stage capitalistic society. (Putting aside the truly dangerous in pinstripe suits and ties for the moment.)
draft_translation: In a country with a culture of denunciation, which already existed before the Corona pandemic, there was already a lot of public agitation against the most dangerous opponents of the BRD; let's say against civil democratic society, let's say against the late capitalist society. (Here nothing about the really dangerous people in a suit and tie.)
final_translation: In a country with a culture of denunciation, which already existed before the Coronavirus pandemic, there was already a lot of public agitation against the most dangerous opponents of the BRD; let's say, against civil democratic society, let's say, against the late capitalist society. (Here nothing about the really dangerous people in a suit and tie.)

src: Nun gibt die Stuttgarter Zeitung, die sonst eher hinter Raudis in den S-Bahnen oder Onanisten im Park her ist, eine Neuauflage mit des "Kriegsverbrechers" Putins Freunden. Weil die so schön sind, gibt es eine Bildergalerie. Natürlich ist die StZ schlecht informiert, denn es gibt in dieser Welt zu der Asien, Afrika und Lateinamerika gehören vielleicht mehr "Russenfreunde" als die StZ Platz für Bilder hat.
ref: Now the Stuttgarter Zeitung, which would otherwise be chasing stories about rowdy individuals on the regional trains or people masturbating in the park, has published a new edition featuring friends of the "war criminal" Putin. Since they are so good-looking, there is picture gallery. Obviously, the Stuttgarter Zeitung is poorly informed, since there may be more "Russian friends" around the world in Asia, Africa, and Latin America than the Stuttgarter Zeitung has room for pictures.
draft_translation: The Stuttgart newspaper, which is usually chasing Raudis in the S-Bahn or Onanists in the park, now publishes a new edition featuring "war criminals" Putin's friends. Because they are so nice, there is a photo gallery. Of course, the StZ is poorly informed, because in this world, which includes Asia, Africa, and Latin America, there may be more "Russians" than the StZ has space for pictures.
final_translation: The Stuttgart newspaper, which is known for tracking Raudis in the S-Bahn or Onanists in the park, now publishes a new edition featuring "war criminals" Putin's friends. Because they are so nice, there is a photo gallery. Of course, the StZ is poorly informed, because in this world, which includes Asia, Africa, and Latin America, there may be more "Russians" than the StZ has space for pictures.

src: Aber darum geht es nicht, sondern: Auf Platz 1 bis 5 (!) steht Frau Wagenknecht, dann folgt Frau Schwarzer.
ref: But that's not what this is about, instead: Mrs. Wagenknecht is in places 1 to 5 (!), followed by Mrs. Schwarzer.
draft_translation: But that's not the point: Women Wagenknecht is on place 1 to 5 (!), then comes Frau Schwarzer.
final_translation: But that's not the point: Woman Wagenknecht is on place 1 to 5 (!), then comes Woman Schwarzer.

src: Nun, ich kenne in meiner Umgebung niemand mehr, der dieses Blatt liest. Wenn doch, wäre es jetzt höchste Zeit. Wir haben das bekannte Niveau erreicht, wo nichts mehr darunter ist.
ref: Now, I don't know anyone in my circles who still reads this magazine. If there is, it's about time. We have reached that well-known level from which it is impossible to descend further.
draft_translation: Well, I know of no one in my surroundings who still reads this paper. If there is anyone, now would be the very best time. We have reached the familiar level where there is nothing left beneath it.
final_translation: Well, I know of no one in my surroundings who still reads this sheet. If there is anyone, now would be the perfect time. We have reached the known level where nothing remains beneath it.

src: Und spätestens jetzt, gut dialektisch, sollte Frau Wagenknecht die beliebteste Politikerin aller noch nicht ganz verblödeten, d.h. friedliebenden, pazifistischen und antimilitaristischen Menschen sein. (Und hier ist nun keine Differenzierung mehr nötig.)
ref: And by now at the very latest, stated kindly, Mrs. Wagenknecht should be the most popular politician among any people who are not yet completely daft, i.e., those who are peace-loving, pacifist, and anti-military. (And now there is no further need to differentiate.)
draft_translation: And by now, at least dialectally, Frau Wagenknecht should be the most popular politician among those who have not yet been dulled, i.e., peace-loving, pacifist, and anti-militarist people. (And here, no further differentiation is needed.)

src: Harald Glööckler reicht Scheidung von seinem Mann Dieter Schroth ein
ref: Harald Glööckler filed for divorce from his husband Dieter Schroth
draft_translation: Harald Glööckler presents divorce from her husband Dieter Schroth
final_translation: Harald Glööckler files for divorce from his husband Dieter Schroth

src: Designer Harald Glööckler (57) und sein Mann Dieter Schroth (74) haben sich getrennt. Das bestätigte Glööcklers Anwalt Christian-Oliver Moser gegenüber der "Bild"-Zeitung und RTL in gleichem Wortlaut. Dort heißt es: "Ich kann bestätigen, dass mein Mandant über seine Familienanwältin beim zuständigen Gericht einen Antrag auf Aufhebung seiner Lebenspartnerschaft gestellt hat. Über Details äußere ich mich nicht".
ref: Designer Harald Glööckler (57) and his husband Dieter Schroth (74) have split up. This was confirmed by Glööckler's lawyer Christian-Oliver Moser to the "Bild" newspaper and RTL in the same wording. He stated: "I can confirm that my client has applied for the dissolution of his civil partnership at the competent court through his family lawyer. I will not discuss the details."
draft_translation: Designer Harald Glööckler (57) and his husband Dieter Schroth (74) have separated. This was confirmed by Harald Glööckler's lawyer Christian-Oliver Moser to the "Bild" newspaper and RTL in identical words. It says: "I can confirm that my client has submitted an application for the annulment of his same-sex partnership through his family lawyer to the competent court. I do not comment on the details."
final_translation: Designer Harald Glööckler (57) and his husband Dieter Schroth (74) have separated. This was confirmed by Harald Glööckler's lawyer Christian-Oliver Moser to the "Bild" newspaper and RTL in the same words. They stated: "I can confirm that my client has submitted an application for the annulment of his same-sex partnership through his family lawyer to the competent court. I do not comment on the details."

src: Glööckler und sein Lebenspartner Schroth waren 35 Jahre zusammen, Trennungsgerüchte gab es schon seit etwa einem Jahr. Nach seiner Dschungelcamp-Teilnahme soll der Modedesigner bereits aus dem gemeinsamen Haus in der Pfalz nach Berlin gezogen sein, heißt es in verschiedenen Medienberichten. Auch in der RTL-Show sprach er über Eheprobleme.
ref: Glööckler and his life partner Schroth were together for 35 years; rumors of a split have been going around for about a year. After the fashion designer took part in Jungle Camp, he had already allegedly moved out of their shared house in the Palatinate and on to Berlin, according to various media reports. He also spoke about marital problems on the RTL television program.
draft_translation: Glööckler and his partner Schroth were together for 35 years. Divorce rumors have been around for about a year. According to various media reports, after his participation in Dschungelcamp, the fashion designer has already moved out of their shared house in the Palatinate to Berlin. He also spoke about marital problems in the RTL show.
final_translation: Glööckler and his partner Schroth were together for 35 years. Divorce rumors have been around for about a year. According to various media reports, after his participation in Dschungelcamp, the fashion designer has already moved from their shared house in the Palatinate to Berlin. He also spoke about marital problems in the RTL show.

src: SS-Massakers in Oradour-sur-Glane: Letzter Überlebender tot
ref: SS massacres in Oradour-sur-Glane: The last survivor has died
draft_translation: Last Survivor of Oradour-sur-Glane Massacre Dies
final_translation: Last Survivor of the Oradour-sur-Glane Massacre Dies

src: In dem zerstörten Dorf nordwestlich von Limoges, dessen Ruinen erhalten blieben, wurde 1999 ein Gedenkzentrum eingerichtet. Frankreichs Präsident Emmanuel Macron hatte Hébras vor einem Jahr mit dem nationalen Verdienstorden ausgezeichnet. Hébras habe für die Freiheit gekämpft und die Werte Frankreichs verteidigt, sagte Macron. Außerdem habe er zum deutsch-französischen Frieden beigetragen. Der Überlebende hatte sich unter anderem für deutsch-französische Jugendbegegnungen eingesetzt.
ref: In 1999, a memorial center was established in the destroyed village northwest of Limoges, the ruins of which remain. French President Emmanuel Macron awarded Hébras the National Order of Merit one year ago. Hébras fought for freedom and defended France's values, said Macron. Moreover, he contributed to peace between Germany and France. The survivor advocated for activities including German and French youths, among others.
draft_translation: In the destroyed village of Hébras northwest of Limoges, whose ruins remained intact, a memorial center was established in 1999. French President Emmanuel Macron had honored Hébras with the National Order of Merit a year earlier. Macron said Hébras had fought for freedom and defended the values of France. He also contributed to the Franco-German peace. The survivor had also advocated for Franco-German youth exchanges.
final_translation: In the destroyed village in Hébras northwest of Limoges, whose ruins remained intact, a memorial center was established in 1999. French President Emmanuel Macron had honored Hébras with the National Order of Merit a year earlier. Macron said Hébras had fought for freedom and defended the values of France. He also contributed to the French-German peace. The survivor had also advocated for Franco-German youth encounters.

src: Eine Kurvenlage für 14 Häuser: In Homeien kennt jeder jeden
ref: Corner for 14 houses: Everybody knows everybody in Homeien
draft_translation: A curve for 14 houses: In Homeien, everyone knows everyone
final_translation: A curve layout for 14 houses: In Homeien, everyone knows everyone

src: LZ-Serie Nordlippische Weiler: In Homeien leben nicht selten drei, vier Generationen unter einem Dach. Hier finden die Bewohner Idylle pur. Im Sommer brausen auch mal 300 Motorräder pro Tag die kurvige Strecke zwischen Niedermeien und Hillentrup lang - und manche auch gleich wieder zurück.
ref: Landeszeitung series on North Lippe hamlets: it is not unusual for three or four generations to live in the same house in Homeien. This is where the residents find pure idyll. Up to 300 motorcycles per day travel the curved stretch of road between Niedermeien and Hillentrup in summer - some of which travel straight back again.
draft_translation: The LZ Series Nordlippische Weiler: In Homeien, it is not uncommon for three or four generations to live under one roof. The residents enjoy pure idyll. In the summer, up to 300 motorcycles per day may roar along the winding route between Niedermeien and Hillentrup - and some even return immediately.
final_translation: The LZ Series Nordlippische Weiler: In Homeien, it is not uncommon for three or four generations to live under one roof. The residents enjoy pure idyllic tranquility. In the summer, up to 300 motorcycles per day roar along the winding route between Niedermeien and Hillentrup - and some even return right away.

src: Deutsche-Bank-Chef Christian Sewing hält weitere Zinserhöhungen im Kampf gegen die hohe Teuerungsrate für "absolut" notwendig. "Die inflationären Risiken sind weiter groß. Die Kosten für Energie können leicht wieder steigen, und auch die Öffnung Chinas kann den Preisen vorübergehend einen Schub geben", sagte Sewing der "Welt am Sonntag".
ref: Deutsche Bank CEO Christian Sewing believes that additional interest-rate hikes are "absolutely" necessary to combat high inflation. "The inflationary risks remain high. Energy prices can easily increase again, and China opening up may temporarily push up prices," Sewing told "Welt am Sonntag."
draft_translation: German Bank CEO Christian Sewing considers further interest rate hikes necessary in the fight against the high inflation rate. "Inflationary risks remain significant. Energy costs could rise slightly again, and China's opening could temporarily boost prices," said Sewing to the "Welt am Sonntag".
final_translation: German Bank CEO Christian Sewing considers further interest rate hikes necessary in the fight against the high inflation rate. "Inflationary risks remain significant. Energy costs could rise slightly again, and China's opening could temporarily boost prices," said Sewing to the "Welt am Sonntag".

src: Die Europäische Zentralbank (EZB) hatte Anfang Februar zum fünften Mal in Folge die Zinsen im Euroraum angehoben und eine weitere Erhöhung um erneut 0,5 Prozentpunkte für die Sitzung am 16. März in Aussicht gestellt. Der Leitzins im Euroraum liegt inzwischen bei 3,0 Prozent. Der Einlagensatz, den Geschäftsbanken erhalten, wenn sie Geld bei der EZB parken, beträgt 2,5 Prozent.
ref: The European Central Bank (ECB) increased interest rates in the Eurozone for the fifth time in early February and a further increase of 0.5 percentage points during the meeting on 16 March appears likely. In the meantime, the base rate in the Eurozone is 3.0 percent. The deposit rate, which commercial banks receive when they store their money with the ECB, is 2.5 percent.
draft_translation: The European Central Bank (ECB) had raised interest rates for the fifth consecutive time in early February and had indicated another increase of 0.5 percentage points for the meeting on March 16. The key interest rate in the euro area is now at 3.0 percent. The deposit rate, which commercial banks receive when they park money with the ECB, is 2.5 percent.
final_translation: The European Central Bank (ECB) had indicated raising interest rates for the fifth consecutive time in early February and had indicated another increase of 0.5 percentage points for the meeting on March 16. The key interest rate in the euro area is now at 3.0 percent. The deposit rate, which commercial banks receive when they hold money with the ECB, is 2.5 percent.

src: Höhere Zinsen verteuern Kredite. Dies kann die Nachfrage bremsen und so hohen Teuerungsraten entgegenwirken. Höhere Kreditzinsen können zugleich dazu führen, dass Investitionen aufgeschoben werden und somit das Wirtschaftswachstum schwächer ausfällt.
ref: Higher interest rates make borrowing more expensive. This may reduce demand and therefore counteract high inflation rates. Higher borrowing rates may also lead to delayed investment, thereby weakening economic growth.
draft_translation: Higher interest rates make loans more expensive. This can slow down demand and help counter high inflation rates. Higher loan interest rates can also lead to delayed investments, thus resulting in weaker economic growth.
final_translation: Higher interest rates make loans more expensive. This can slow down demand and counteract high inflation rates. Higher loan interest rates can also lead to delayed investments, thus resulting in weaker economic growth.

src: Auch für hoch verschuldete Eurostaaten wie zum Beispiel Italien sind steigende Zinsen eine Belastung. "Die Folgen einer dauerhaft hohen Inflation sind wesentlich gravierender als die höherer Finanzierungskosten für einige Länder", sagte Sewing. "Natürlich müssen wir das im Blick behalten, aber ein hoher Schuldenstand darf die EZB nicht davon abhalten, konsequent zu handeln".
ref: Increasing interest rates are also a burden for highly indebted European states, such as Italy. "The consequences of sustained high inflation are significantly more serious than the higher costs of financing for certain countries," said Sewing. "Obviously, we must keep an eye on that, but higher debt levels must not discourage the ECB from acting consistently."
draft_translation: Even for highly indebted Eurozone countries such as, for example, Italy, rising interest rates are a burden. "The consequences of persistent high inflation are significantly more severe than the higher financing costs for some countries," said Sewing. "Of course, we must take this into account, but a high debt level must not prevent the ECB from acting consistently."
final_translation: Even for highly indebted Eurozone countries such as, for example, Italy, rising interest rates are a burden. "The consequences of persistent high inflation are significantly more severe than the higher financing costs for some countries," said Sewing. "Of course, we must take this into account, but a high debt level must not prevent the ECB from acting consistently."

src: Die EZB strebt für den Euroraum mittelfristig Preisstabilität bei einer Teuerungsrate von zwei Prozent an. Diese Zielmarke ist seit Monaten weit entfernt. Im Januar schwächte sich der Preisauftrieb zwar erneut ab, dennoch lagen die Verbraucherpreise im Währungsraum der inzwischen 20 Länder um 8,5 Prozent über dem Niveau des Vorjahresmonats.
ref: The ECB aims for price stability in the Eurozone over the medium-term with an inflation rate of two percent. This target has remained very distant for months. Though inflation weakened in January, consumer prices in the currency area among the now 20 countries were 8.5 percent higher than at the same time last year.
draft_translation: The European Central Bank aims for price stability in the Eurozone over the medium term with an inflation rate of two percent. This target has been far off for months. Although the price increase weakened again in January, consumer prices in the currency area of the now 20 countries were 8.5 percent higher than in the previous year's month.
final_translation: The European Central Bank aims for price stability in the Eurozone over the medium term with an inflation rate of two percent. This target has been unattainable for months. Although the price rise weakened again in January, consumer prices in the currency area of the now 20 countries were 8.5 percent higher than in the same month of the previous year.

src: Höhere Teuerungsraten schmälern die Kaufkraft von Verbraucherinnen und Verbrauchern, denn sie können sich für einen Euro dann weniger leisten. Stark gestiegene Energiepreise, die die Inflation maßgeblich treiben, sind auch für Unternehmen eine Last.
ref: Higher inflation decreases consumers' purchasing power, because they can afford less for a euro. Sharp increases in energy prices, which overwhelmingly drive inflation, are also a burden for corporations.
draft_translation: Higher inflation rates reduce the purchasing power of consumers, because they can afford less for a euro. Strongly rising energy prices, which significantly drive inflation, are also a burden for businesses.
final_translation: Higher inflation rates reduce the purchasing power of consumers, because they can afford less for a euro. Strongly rising energy prices, which significantly drive inflation, are also a burden for businesses.

src: Wenn die Inflation hoch bleibe, werde der private Konsum "früher oder später einbrechen", warnte Sewing, der auch Präsident des Bundesverbandes deutscher Banken (BdB) ist. "Darin sehe ich aktuell die größte Gefahr für die deutsche Konjunktur. Aber ich bin optimistisch, dass wir dieses Szenario vermeiden können".
ref: If inflation remains high, private consumption will "collapse sooner or later," warns Sewing, who is also president of the Association of German Banks (AGB). "This is where I currently see the greatest danger for German economic activity. However, I am optimistic that we will be able to avoid this scenario."
draft_translation: If inflation remains high, private consumption will "eventually decline," warned Sewing, who is also president of the German Banking Association (BdB). "In that regard, I see the greatest threat to the German economy. But I am optimistic that we can avoid this scenario."
final_translation: If inflation remains high, private consumption will "eventually decline," warned Sewing, who is also president of the German Banking Association (BdB). "In that regard, I see the greatest threat to the German economy. But I am optimistic that we can avoid this scenario."

src: Bosch-Chef Stefan Hartung hofft auf eine breite Debatte zum von Bundeskanzler Olaf Scholz (SPD) ausgerufenen "Deutschland-Tempo" bei Infrastrukturprojekten. "Es wird einen politischen und gesellschaftlichen Dialog dazu geben müssen. Und er wird vielleicht auch ein bisschen kontroverser sein", sagte er der Deutschen Presse-Agentur in Stuttgart. Er hoffe, dass am Ende ein Regelwerk herauskomme, mit dem es zwar nicht zwingend so schnell gehen müsse wie bei den um den Jahreswechsel in Betrieb genommenen LNG-Terminals - aber auch nicht so langsam wie vorher.
ref: Bosch CEO Stefan Hartung hopes for an extensive debate with Federal Chancellor Olaf Scholz (SPD) regarding the "German pace" of infrastructure projects that he mentioned. "There must be a political and social dialog in this regard. Perhaps it will also be a little controversial," he told the Deutsche Presse-Agentur in Stuttgart. He hopes for this to produce a set of regulations stipulating that not all projects must be completed as fast as the LNG terminals that were brought into operation around the end of the year - but also not as slowly as before.
draft_translation: Bosch-Chef Stefan Hartung hopes for a broad debate around the "Germany Speed" initiative launched by Chancellor Olaf Scholz (SPD) for infrastructure projects. "There will have to be a political and societal dialogue about it, and it may also be a bit controversial," he told the German Press Agency in Stuttgart. He hopes that in the end, a framework will emerge, which will not necessarily require projects to proceed as quickly as those put into operation around the New Year - but also not as slowly as before."
final_translation: Bosch-Chef Stefan Hartung hopes for a broad debate around the "Germany Speed" initiative launched by Chancellor Olaf Scholz (SPD) for infrastructure projects. "There will have to be a political and societal dialogue about it, and it may also be a bit controversial," he told the German Press Agency in Stuttgart. He hopes that in the end, a regulatory framework will emerge, which will not necessarily require projects to proceed as quickly as those put into operation around the year-end - but also not as slowly as before."

src: Mitte Dezember war nach zehn Monaten Planungs- und Bauzeit das erste deutsche Terminal für den Import von Flüssigerdgas (LNG) eröffnet worden. Ziel war, die Lücke bei der Gasversorgung wegen ausbleibender russischer Gaslieferungen ein Stück weit zu schließen. Bundeskanzler Olaf Scholz (SPD) hatte zu dem Anlass von einem neuen "Deutschland-Tempo" gesprochen. Zudem hatte die Bundesregierung zuletzt eine Beschleunigung von Genehmigungsverfahren für Windräder und Stromleitungen auf den Weg gebracht.
ref: In mid-December, after 10 months of planning and construction, the first German terminal for importing liquid natural gas (LNG) was opened. The goal was to attempt to close part of the gap in the gas supply due to the absence of Russian gas deliveries. On this occasion, Chancellor Olaf Scholz (SPD) referred to a new "German pace." The German government also recently set into motion the acceleration of approval procedures for windmills and power lines.
draft_translation: In mid-December, after ten months of planning and construction time, the first German terminal for the import of liquefied natural gas (LNG) was opened. The goal was to partially close the gap in gas supply due to the absence of Russian gas deliveries. Chancellor Olaf Scholz (SPD) spoke about a new "Germany speed" on the occasion. Additionally, the federal government had recently accelerated the approval processes for wind turbines and power lines.
final_translation: In mid-December, after ten months of planning and construction, the first German terminal for the import of liquefied natural gas (LNG) was opened. The goal was to partially close the gap in gas supply due to the absence of Russian gas deliveries. Chancellor Olaf Scholz (SPD) spoke about a new "Germany Tempo" on the occasion. Additionally, the federal government had recently accelerated the approval processes for wind turbines and power lines.

src: "Erst mal ist es doch sehr beruhigend, dass die Regierung so schnell handelt, wenn es darauf ankommt. Das sollte aber nicht automatisch bedeuten, dass wir ab jetzt immer so kategorisch handeln und etwa dem Nachbarn gegen seinen Willen ein Windrad in den Garten stellen", sagte Hartung. Es müsse daher immer noch einen Aushandlungsprozess geben, was man als Gesellschaft richtig und falsch finde.
ref: Firstly, it is extremely comforting that the government acts so quickly when it is necessary. However, that should not automatically mean that we will always act so categorically in future, and do things like placing a windmill in a neighbors garden against 'his will," said Hartung. Therefore, there should still be a negotiation process to find out what society thinks is right and wrong.
draft_translation: "At first, it is indeed reassuring that the government acts so quickly when it matters. However, that should not automatically mean that we will now always act so categorically, for example, by installing a wind turbine in a neighbor's garden against their will," said Hartung. There must therefore still be a negotiation process, something that society can judge as right or wrong.
final_translation: At first, it is indeed reassuring that the government acts so quickly when it matters. However, that should not automatically mean that we will now always act so categorically, for example, by installing a wind turbine in a neighbor's garden against their will," said Hartung. There must therefore still be a negotiation process, something that society can determine as right or wrong.

src: In der Vergangenheit habe man es mit dem klassischen Regelwerk versucht und nicht geschafft. "Wir sollten uns nochmal Gedanken machen, ob das bisherige Vorgehen so richtig war. Vielleicht haben wir es mit dem Regelwerk auch übertrieben und es uns zu kompliziert gemacht".
ref: Previously, attempts were made to use classical regulations, but this did not work. "We should rethink whether the previous approach was correct. Maybe we went overboard with the regulations and this has overcomplicated things for us."
draft_translation: In the past, people have tried with the classical rulebook and failed. "We should think again about whether the previous approach was correct. Perhaps we have overcomplicated it with the rulebook."
final_translation: In the past, people have attempted the classical rules and failed. "We should reconsider whether the previous approach was correct. Perhaps we overcomplicated it."

src: Angesichts der vielen offenen Aufgaben etwa beim Ausbau der Stromtrassen beneide er die Bundesregierung und die beteiligten Unternehmen aber nicht, sagte Hartung. "Als Konsument dieser Energien brauche ich den Ausbau unbedingt und er soll so grün sein, wie es geht".
ref: From the perspective of the many unfinished tasks, such as expansion of high-voltage power lines, Hartung says he does not envy the German government and the companies involved. "As a consumer of these types of energy, I absolutely need this expansion, and it should be as sustainable as possible."
draft_translation: Hartung said: "Considering the many open tasks, such as the expansion of power lines, he envies the federal government and the involved companies, said Hartung. 'As a consumer of these energies, I need the expansion absolutely, and it should be as green as possible'."
final_translation: Hartung said: "Considering the many open tasks, such as the expansion of power lines, he does not envy the federal government and the involved companies. 'As a consumer of these energies, I need the expansion absolutely, and it should be as green as possible.'"

src: Gewerkschaft warnt vor Zerschlagung des Bayer-Konzerns
ref: Union warns of disruption of the Bayer Group
draft_translation: Union warns of breakup of Bayer corporation
final_translation: Union warns of split of Bayer company

src: Die Chemie-Gewerkschaft IG BCE warnt nach einem angekündigten Chefwechsel bei Bayer vor einer Zerschlagung des Konzerns. "Aus Sicht der Beschäftigten ist Bayer mit seinen drei Standbeinen genau richtig aufgestellt für die Herausforderungen der Zukunft", sagte Francesco Grioli, Vorstandsmitglied der Gewerkschaft und Bayer-Aufsichtsrat, der "Rheinischen Post" (Samstagsausgabe).
ref: The chemical workers' union IG BCE warned of disruption to the group after the replacement of the Bayer CEO was announced. "Bayer, with its three pillars, is perfectly positioned to take on challenges of the future from its employees' perspective," Francesco Grioli, board member of the workers' union and Bayer supervisory board, told the "Rheinische Post" (Saturday edition).
draft_translation: The chemical union IG BCE warns after an announced leadership change at Bayer of the potential breakup of the company. "From the perspective of the employees, Bayer with its three pillars is exactly the right structure for the challenges of the future," said Francesco Grioli, a board member of the union and member of the Bayer supervisory board, in the "Rheinische Post" (Saturday edition).
final_translation: The chemical union IG BCE warns following an announced leadership change at Bayer of the potential disintegration of the company. "From the perspective of the employees, Bayer with its three pillars is exactly the right structure for the challenges of the future," said Francesco Grioli, a board member of the union and member of the Bayer supervisory board, in the "Rheinische Post" (Saturday edition).

src: Gemeint sind das Pharmageschäft mit rezeptpflichtigen Medikamenten, der Bereich Consumer Health mit rezeptfreien Medikamenten und das Agrargeschäft. "Die Transformation der Industrie bewältigt man nur mit einer Unternehmenspolitik, die auf Risikostreuung und Nachhaltigkeit beruht - und nicht auf Hedgefonds-Aktivismus".
ref: This refers to the pharmaceutical business offering prescription-only drugs, the business area of consumer health offering over-the-counter drugs, and the agricultural business. "Transformation of the industry can only be overcome with corporate policies that are based on risk distribution and sustainability - and not on hedge fund activism."
draft_translation: The intended areas are the pharmaceutical business with prescription medications, the consumer health area with over-the-counter medications, and the agricultural business. "The transformation of the industry can only be achieved with a corporate policy based on risk dispersion and sustainability - and not on hedge fund activism."
final_translation: The intended areas are the pharmaceutical business with prescription medications, the consumer health sector with over-the-counter medications, and the agricultural business. "The transformation of the industry can only be achieved with a corporate policy based on risk dispersion and sustainability - and not on hedge fund activism."

src: Hintergrund ist der am Donnerstag verkündete Chefwechsel beim Pharma- und Agrarchemiekonzern. Der umstrittene Chef Werner Baumann wird noch diesen Sommer den Posten räumen. Übernehmen soll Anfang Juni der Ex-Pharmachef des schweizerischen Rivalen Roche, Bill Anderson.
ref: The backdrop was the replacement of the pharmaceutical and agricultural chemical group's CEO that was announced on Thursday. Controversial CEO Werner Baumann will vacate his post this summer. Bill Anderson, former pharmaceutical CEO of Swiss rival Roche, will take over in early June.
draft_translation: The background is the announced leadership change at the pharmaceutical and agricultural chemical conglomerate on Thursday. The controversial CEO Werner Baumann will step down from his position this summer. The new CEO is expected to take over at the beginning of June, being the former pharmaceutical CEO of the Swiss rival Roche, Bill Anderson.
final_translation: The background is the announced leadership change at the pharmaceutical and agricultural chemical conglomerate on Thursday. The controversial CEO Werner Baumann will step down from his position this summer. The new CEO is expected to take over at the beginning of June, who is the former pharmaceutical CEO of the Swiss rival Roche, Bill Anderson.

src: Baumann steht seit langem in der Kritik. Die 2018 abgeschlossene Übernahme des US-Saatgutherstellers Monsanto für 63 Milliarden Dollar hängt dem Manager nach. Mit dem Kauf hatten sich die Leverkusener teure Rechtsstreitigkeiten um angebliche Krebsrisiken des Unkrautvernichters Glyphosat ins Haus geholt. Die Bayer-Aktie befand sich über Jahre im Sinkflug. Im Jahr 2019 verweigerten die Aktionäre dem Vorstandschef auf der Hauptversammlung gar die Entlastung.
ref: Baumann has been criticized for a long time. The 2018 takeover of the U.S. seed manufacturer Monsanto for 63 billion U.S. dollars weighs heavily on the manager's mind. This purchase brought with it expensive lawsuits regarding the alleged risk of cancer caused by the herbicide glyphosate. Bayer's stock has been declining for years. Shareholders even refused to approve actions by the chairperson of the board during the annual general meeting in 2019.
draft_translation: Baumann has been under criticism for a long time. The 2018 acquisition of the US seed company Monsanto for 63 billion dollars has brought criticism upon the manager. With the purchase, the Leverkusen management inherited costly legal disputes over alleged cancer risks of the herbicide Glyphosate. The Bayer stock has been in a downward trend for years. In 2019, shareholders refused to reappoint the CEO at the annual general meeting.

src: Schon länger war bekannt, dass Baumann keine Verlängerung seines Vertrags anstrebt, der eigentlich noch bis 2024 laufen sollte. Druck gemacht hatten langfristig orientierte strategische Investoren. Zuletzt mischten auch mehrere aktivistische angelsächsische Investoren wie Bluebell Capital mit. Bluebell dringt laut einem Medienbericht auf eine Aufspaltung des Konzerns.
ref: It had been known for a while that Baumann would not seek to extend his contract, which actually should have gone until 2024. Long-term strategic investors exerted pressure. Recently, multiple activist investors from the Anglo-Saxon sphere, such as Bluebell Capital, got involved. According to a media report, Bluebell is pressing for the group to be split.
draft_translation: It has been known for a long time that Baumann does not intend to extend his contract, which was originally set to run until 2024. Long-term oriented strategic investors had been putting pressure on the company. Recently, several activist Anglo-Saxon investors, such as Bluebell Capital, have also become involved. According to a media report, Bluebell is pushing for the split of the company.
final_translation: It has been known for a long time that Baumann does not intend to extend his contract, which was originally set to run until 2024. Long-term oriented strategic investors had been putting pressure on the company. Recently, several activist Anglo-Saxon investors, such as Bluebell Capital, have also become involved. According to a media report, Bluebell is pushing for the split of the company.

src: Der sehr kleine Fonds mit unbekannter Beteiligungshöhe an Bayer ist für ein aggressives Vorgehen bekannt. Eine Abspaltung "der Sparte Consumer Health wäre ein möglicher Weg, um den Unternehmenswert zu steigern", sagte Markus Manns, Fondsmanager bei Union Investment, der "Rheinischen Post". Eine Abspaltung der weit größeren Agrarsparte Crop Science hält er dagegen nicht für machbar.
ref: The very small fund, whose ownership interest in Bayer is unknown, is known for its aggressive approach. A spin-off "of the Consumer Health division would be one possible way to increase the value of the company," said Markus Manns, a fund manager at Union Investment, according to the "Rheinische Post." By contrast, he does not believe that a spin-off of the far larger Crop Science agricultural division is feasible.
draft_translation: The very small fund with an unknown investment amount at Bayer is known for an aggressive approach. "A spin-off of the Consumer Health division would be a possible way to increase the company's value," said Markus Manns, fund manager at Union Investment, to the "Rheinische Post." He does not consider a spin-off of the much larger Agrar division Crop Science feasible."
final_translation: The very small fund with an unknown investment size at Bayer is known for an aggressive approach. "A spin-off of the Consumer Health division would be a possible way to increase the company's value," said Markus Manns, fund manager at Union Investment, to the "Rheinische Post." He does not consider a spin-off of the much larger Agrar division Crop Science feasible.

src: Hunderttausende wollen gegen Rentenreform demonstrieren
ref: Hundreds of thousands of people want to demonstrate against retirement reform
draft_translation: Hundreds of thousands want to demonstrate against pension reform
final_translation: Hundreds of thousands want to demonstrate against pension reform

src: Paris
ref: Paris
draft_translation: Paris
final_translation: Paris

src: Auch am Samstag wollen die Franzosen wieder gegen die geplante Rentenreform auf die Straße gehen.
ref: On Saturday, the French once again want to take to the streets in defiance of the planned retirement reforms.
draft_translation: The French also want to go onto the streets again on Saturday against the planned pension reform.
final_translation: The French also want to go again onto the streets on Saturday against the planned pension reform.

src: Einem Vorhaben der Regierung stellen die Gewerkschaften den geballten Protest auf der Straße entgegen. Hunderttausende wollen am Samstag erneut gegen die Rentenreform demonstrieren.
ref: The unions organizing the concentrated public demonstration are contesting a proposal by the government. Hundreds of thousands of people want to demonstrate against pension reform again on Saturday.
draft_translation: The trade unions oppose the government's initiative with a strong protest on the streets. Hundreds of thousands want to demonstrate again against the pension reform on Saturday.
final_translation: The trade unions oppose the government's initiative with a massive protest on the streets. Hundreds of thousands want to demonstrate again against the pension reform on Saturday.

src: In Frankreich werden am Samstag erneut landesweit Hunderttausende Menschen erwartet, die gegen die geplante Rentenreform von Präsident Emmanuel Macron demonstrieren wollen. Zum vierten Mal mobilisieren die Gewerkschaften gegen die Pläne der Mitte-Regierung zu einem Anheben des Renteneintrittsalters von 62 auf 64 Jahre. Zweimal bereits gingen über eine Million Menschen auf die Straßen und es gab landesweite Streiks. Am vergangenen Dienstag wurden 750.000 Teilnehmer bei Protesten gezählt. Über die umstrittene Reform läuft seit einer Woche eine turbulente Debatte im Parlament.
ref: On Saturday, once again, hundreds of thousands of people throughout France are expected to demonstrate against the pension reform planned by President Emmanuel Macron. The unions are mobilizing for the fourth time against the plans of the centrist government to increase the state retirement age from 62 to 64 years. Over a million people have already taken to the streets twice, and there have been nationwide strikes. Last Tuesday, 750,000 participants were counted during the demonstrations. A heated debate about the controversial reform has continued in Parliament for the past week.
draft_translation: In France, hundreds of thousands of people are expected again nationwide this Saturday to protest against the planned pension reform proposed by President Emmanuel Macron. For the fourth time, unions are mobilizing against the plans of the center government to raise the retirement age from 62 to 64 years. Twice already, over a million people have taken to the streets, and there have been nationwide strikes. Last Tuesday, 750,000 participants were counted at the protests. A controversial debate over the reform has been raging in parliament for a week.
final_translation: In France, hundreds of thousands of people are expected to protest again nationwide this Saturday against the planned pension reform by President Emmanuel Macron. For the fourth time, unions are mobilizing against the plans of the center-right government to raise the retirement age from 62 to 64 years. Twice, over a million people have taken to the streets, and there have been nationwide strikes. Last Tuesday, 750,000 participants were counted at the protests. A controversial debate over the reform has been raging in parliament for a week.

src: Bereits jetzt arbeiten viele Menschen in Frankreich länger als bis zum Alter von 62 Jahren, wenn sie mit Erreichen der Altersgrenze noch nicht lange genug für eine abschlagsfreie Rente eingezahlt haben. In vielen anstrengenden Berufen könnten die Menschen kaum länger arbeiten, meinen die Gegner der Reform. Außerdem wollten die Beschäftigten ihre wohlverdiente Rente genießen können und ihre Gesundheit nicht vollends im Job verschleißen.
ref: There are already many people in France who work past the age of 62 years if they have not paid in long enough to secure a deduction-free pension by the time they reach the age limit. It is barely possible for people to continue working in physically demanding professions, say the opponents of the reform. Moreover, employees want to be able to enjoy their hard-earned pension and not completely destroy their health because of their job.
draft_translation: Many people in France are already working longer than until the age of 62, even if they have not contributed long enough to qualify for a pension without any deductions. Opponents of the reform argue that in many demanding jobs, people could hardly work any longer. Additionally, workers want to be able to enjoy their well-earned pension and not completely wear out their health in their job.
final_translation: Many people in France are already working longer until the age of 62, even if they have not contributed long enough to qualify for a pension without any deductions. Opponents of the reform argue that in many demanding jobs, people could hardly work any longer. Additionally, workers want to be able to enjoy their well-earned pension and not completely wear out their health in their job.

src: Macron: Drohendes Defizit in Rentenkasse
ref: Macron: Looming deficit in pension funds
draft_translation: Macron: Threatening Deficit in Pension Fund
final_translation: Macron: Potential Deficit in Pension Fund

src: Macron begründet die Reform mit einem drohenden Defizit in der Rentenkasse. Weil die Bevölkerung immer älter wird, müssten die Beschäftigten mit ihren Beiträgen für eine steigende Zahl von Rentnern aufkommen. Damit die Höhe der Rente stabil gehalten werden könne, müsse die Bevölkerung etwas mehr arbeiten. Die Kritiker zweifeln die Berechnungen der Regierung an und fordern, der Staat müsse andere Geldquellen finden, um das Rentensystem im Gleichgewicht zu halten.
ref: Macron justifies the reform on the grounds that there is a looming deficit in pension funds. Since the population continues to age, employees must fund an increasing number of pensioners with their contributions. In order to maintain pension at a stable level, the population will have to work a bit more. Critics doubt the governmental calculations and advocate for the government finding other sources of money to maintain the equilibrium of the pension system.
draft_translation: Macron justifies the reforms with a looming deficit in the pension fund. Because the population is aging, workers would have to contribute more to support an increasing number of retirees. In order to maintain the level of the pension, the population would have to work longer. Critics doubt the government's calculations and call for the state to find other sources of funding to keep the pension system in balance.

src: Doch nicht nur am Rentenalter will die Regierung schrauben. Die bereits vor Jahren beschlossene Anhebung der nötigen Einzahldauer für eine volle Rente soll beschleunigt werden. Außerdem sollen Einzelrentensysteme mit Privilegien für bestimmte Berufsgruppen abgeschafft werden. Die Mindestrente soll auf etwa 1200 Euro steigen.
ref: However, the government wants to do more than simply fine-tune the retirement age. The increase in the payment duration required for a full pension, decided a few years ago, will be accelerated. In addition, the individual pension systems with privileges for certain professional groups will be abolished. The minimum pension will increase to approximately 1,200 euros.
draft_translation: The government does not only want to tighten the screws at retirement age. The already decided increase in the required contribution period for a full pension is to be accelerated. Additionally, individual pension systems with privileges for certain professional groups are to be abolished. The minimum pension is to rise to about 1200 euros.
final_translation: The government does not only intend to impose stricter measures at retirement age. The already decided increase in the required contribution period for a full pension is to be accelerated. Additionally, individual pension systems with privileges for certain professional groups are to be abolished. The minimum pension is to rise to about 1200 euros.

src: Die Rentenreform gilt als eines der wichtigsten Vorhaben von Präsident Macron. Während der Corona-Pandemie wurde ein erster Anlauf zur Umsetzung der Reform abgebrochen, schon damals gab es massive Proteste und Streiks. Schon etliche Präsidenten vor Macron bemühten sich mit unterschiedlichem Erfolg um Reformen des französischen Rentensystems - breiter Protest und Streiks waren allen gewiss.
ref: Pension reform is one of the most important projects for President Macron. An initial attempt to implement the reform during the coronavirus pandemic was aborted, and even back then, there were massive demonstrations and strikes. Numerous presidents before Macron made efforts to reform the French pension system with varying levels of success - widespread demonstrations and strikes were all but assured.
draft_translation: The pension reform is considered one of the most important initiatives of President Macron. During the Corona pandemic, an initial attempt to implement the reform was abandoned, at that time there were massive protests and strikes. Many presidents before Macron have tried, with varying degrees of success, to reform the French pension system - widespread protests and strikes were certain to occur.
final_translation: The pension reform is considered one of the most important initiatives of President Macron. During the Corona pandemic, an initial attempt to implement the reform was abandoned, at that time there were massive protests and strikes. Many presidents before Macron have tried, with varying degrees of success, to reform the French pension system - widespread protests and strikes were certain to occur.

src: Da Macrons Lager keine absolute Mehrheit im Parlament mehr hat, hofft es, die Reform mit Hilfe der konservativen Républicains durchzubringen, die Unterstützung angekündigt haben. Einige der Abgeordnete aber - selbst aus Macrons Fraktion - haben noch Vorbehalte. Und noch größer als die Furcht vor einer knappen Abstimmung dürfte im Moment bei Macron die Sorge vor lähmenden Streiks sein. Vor den erneuten Demonstrationen am Samstag sagte der Präsident, dass er auf das Verantwortungsbewusstsein der Organisatoren zählen könne, damit diese ruhig verliefen und nicht zu einer Blockade des Landes führten.
ref: Since Macron's party does not have an absolute majority in parliament, it hopes to push through the reform with the aid of the conservative Republicans, who have voiced their support. However, some of the parliamentary representatives still have reservations - including some from Macron's faction. Also, at the moment, Macron is more afraid about paralyzing strikes than a narrow vote. Before the repeated demonstrations on Saturday, the president said that he could rely on the sense of responsibility of the organizers to ensure that the demonstrations are peaceful and do not lead to a blockade of the country.
draft_translation: Since Macron's party no longer has an absolute majority in parliament, it hopes to push through the reform with the conservative Republicans, who have announced their support. However, some members — even from Macron's faction — still have reservations. And greater than the fear of a close vote, Macron's current concern is likely the threat of paralyzing strikes. Ahead of the renewed demonstrations on Saturday, the president said he could count on the organizers' sense of responsibility to ensure the demonstrations proceed peacefully and do not lead to a blockade of the country.
final_translation: Since Macron's party no longer has an absolute majority in parliament, it hopes to push through the reform with the conservative Republicans, who have announced their support. However, some members — even from Macron's faction — still have reservations. And greater than the fear of a narrow vote, Macron's current concern is likely the threat of paralyzing strikes. Ahead of the renewed demonstrations on Saturday, the president said he could count on the organizers' sense of responsibility to ensure the demonstrations proceed peacefully and do not lead to a blockade of the country.

src: Ruhiges Wetter erwartet - in Hochlagen viel Sonne
ref: Calm weather expected - plenty of sun at high altitudes
draft_translation: Ruhiges Wetter erwartet - in Hochlagen viel Sonne
final_translation: Calm weather is expected - sunny conditions at higher elevations

src: Ein mächtiges Hochdruckgebiet liegt über Mitteleuropa und bestimmt das Wetter in Deutschland. Bedeutet das, dass überall mit viel Sonnenschein zu rechnen ist?
ref: A massive high-pressure system is covering Central Europe and determining the weather in Germany. Does that mean that we can count on lots of sunshine everywhere?
draft_translation: A powerful high-pressure system is over Central Europe and determines the weather in Germany. Does that mean that there will be a lot of sunshine everywhere?
final_translation: A powerful high-pressure system is over Central Europe and determines the weather in Germany. Does that mean that there will be a lot of sunshine everywhere?

src: Offenbach
ref: Offenbach
draft_translation: Offenbach
final_translation: Offenbach

src: In Deutschland wird mindestens bis zu Wochenmitte ruhiges Hochdruckwetter erwartet. "Beim Betrachten der Wetterkarten sticht sofort ein mächtiges Hochdruckgebiet direkt über Mitteleuropa ins Auge", erklärt der Meteorologe Markus Übel vom Deutschen Wetterdienst am Samstag in Offenbach. "Zwar verlagert sich dieses Hoch im Laufe der nächsten Woche ein wenig nach Osten. Es bestimmt aber weiterhin das Wetter in Deutschland".
ref: Calm, high-pressure weather is expected in Germany until at least midweek. "If we look at the weather maps, a massive high-pressure system directly over Central Europe is immediately apparent," explains meteorologist Markus Übel from the German Weather Service in Offenbach on Saturday. "Admittedly, this high will move slightly to the east during the course of the next week. However, it will continue to determine the weather in Germany."
draft_translation: In Germany, calm high-pressure weather is expected at least until mid-week. "When looking at the weather maps, a powerful high-pressure area directly over Central Europe immediately catches the eye," explains meteorologist Markus Übel from the German Weather Service in Offenbach on Saturday. "Although this high will shift slightly eastward over the next week, it will continue to determine the weather in Germany."
final_translation: In Germany, calm high-pressure weather is expected at least until mid-week. "When looking at the weather maps, a powerful high-pressure area directly over Central Europe immediately catches the eye," explains meteorologist Markus Übel from the German Weather Service in Offenbach on Saturday. "Although this high will shift slightly eastward over the next week, it will continue to determine the weather in Germany."

src: Allerdings bedeute ruhiges Hochdruckwetter im Winter nicht zwangsläufig auch sonniges Wetter, sagt Übel. "So ein Hoch kann sogar ziemlich gemein sein und den Menschen in den Niederungen tagelang tristes Hochnebelgrau bescheren, während es in den Hochlagen der Mittelgebirge Sonne pur gibt".
ref: However, calm, high-pressure weather in winter does not necessarily also mean sunny weather, says Übel. "This type of high may even be quite nasty and cover the people living in the lowlands in dreary, dense fog for days, while the higher mountain slopes are covered in nothing but sunshine."
draft_translation: However, says Übel, calm high-pressure weather in winter does not necessarily mean sunny weather. "Such a high can even be quite mean and bring days of gloomy high cloud cover to people in the valleys, while the higher elevations of the mountains get sunny weather."
final_translation: However, says Übel, calm high-pressure weather in winter does not necessarily mean sunny weather. "Such a high can even be quite mean and bring days of gloomy high cloud to people in the valleys, while the higher elevations of the mountains get sunny weather."

src: So startet der Sonntag in den meisten Regionen neblig-trüb. Vom Erzgebirge und dem Thüringer Wald bis nach Niederbayern kann es laut DWD auch noch etwas regnen. Vor allem am Alpenrand, aber auch im Südwesten und teils im Westen lockert die Wolkendecke im Tagesverlauf auf und die Sonne kommt immer häufiger zum Vorschein. Im Rest des Landes bleibt es stark bewölkt oder hochnebelartig bedeckt. Die Temperaturen erreichen 4 bis 9 Grad, in Rheinnähe um 10 Grad.
ref: Therefore, Sunday will start off with an opaque fog in most regions. According to the German Weather Service, there may also be some rain from the Erz mountain range and Thuringian Forest to Lower Bavaria. The heavy cloud cover will lift during the course of the day and sunshine will increase in frequency, mostly along the edge of the Alps, but also in the southwest and in some areas of the west. The rest of the country will remain under heavy cloud cover or heavy fog. Temperatures will reach 4 to 9 degrees, with up to 10 degrees near the Rhine.
draft_translation: The Sunday starts in most regions with cloudy and overcast weather. From the Erzgebirge and Thuringian Forest to Lower Bavaria, according to the DWD, there can also be some rain. Especially along the Alpine ridge, but also in the Southwest and partly in the West, the cloud cover clears up during the day and the sun appears more frequently. In the rest of the country, it remains largely cloudy or foggy. Temperatures reach 4 to 9 degrees, with around 10 degrees in the Rhine area.
final_translation: The Sunday starts in most regions with hazy and overcast weather. From the Erzgebirge and Thuringian Forest to Lower Bavaria, according to the DWD, there can also be some rain. Especially along the Alpine ridge, but also in the Southwest and partly in the West, the cloud cover clears up during the day and the sun appears more frequently. In the rest of the country, it remains largely cloudy or foggy. Temperatures reach 4 to 9 degrees, with around 10 degrees in the Rhine area.

src: "Am Montag knabbert dann die allmählich stärker werdende Sonne wieder am Hochnebel und kann ihn im Tagesverlauf mehr und mehr auflösen", sagt der Meteorologe. Am Alpenrand, in den Hochlagen der Mittelgebirge und in Teilen von Nordrhein-Westfalen werde ganztags Sonne erwartet, andernorts müsse sie sich erst durch die Hochnebeldecke kämpfen. Die Höchstwerte liegen bei 5 bis 9 Grad, am Niederrhein werden um 11 Grad, im Dauergrau im Südosten werden dagegen nur um 3 Grad erwartet. Dazu weht schwacher Wind aus unterschiedlichen Richtungen.
ref: On Monday, the gradually increasing sunshine will eat away at the dense fog again, causing it to dissipate more and more during the course of the day," says the meteorologist. Sunshine is expected throughout the day at the edge of the Alps, on the higher mountain slopes, and in parts of North Rhine-Westphalia, while other areas will remain covered in dense fog for some time. Daily highs will be between 5 and 9 degrees, with up to 11 degrees in the lower Rhine region, and only 3 degrees in the southeast, which will be permanently covered in fog. A weak wind will come in from various directions.
draft_translation: The meteorologist says: "On Monday, the gradually strengthening sun will once again nibble at the high cloud cover and be able to dissolve it throughout the day." Along the Alpine ridge, in the higher elevations of the middle mountains, and in parts of North Rhine-Westphalia, sun will be expected all day, while elsewhere it will have to struggle through the high cloud cover. The maximum temperatures will range from 5 to 9 degrees, around 11 degrees along the Lower Rhine, and only around 3 degrees in the continuous gray areas of the southeast. There will be weak winds coming from different directions.
final_translation: The meteorologist says: "On Monday, the gradually strengthening sun will once again weaken the high cloud cover and be able to dissolve it throughout the day." Along the Alpine ridge, in the higher elevations of the middle mountains, and in parts of North Rhine-Westphalia, sun will be expected all day, while elsewhere it will have to struggle through the high cloud cover. The maximum temperatures will range from 5 to 9 degrees, around 11 degrees along the Lower Rhine, and only around 3 degrees in the persistent gray areas of the southeast. There will be weak winds coming from different directions.

src: Am Dienstag kann es in manchen Niederungen erneut nur zähe Auflösung von Nebel oder Hochnebel geben. Ansonsten zeigt sich das Wetter nach Nebelauflösung heiter. In Hochlagen, in weiten Teilen von NRW und am Alpenrand scheint den Prognosen zufolge ganztags die Sonne. Die Temperaturen klettern je nach Sonnenschein auf 5 bis 11 Grad.
ref: Stubborn fog or dense fog may appear again in some low lying areas on Tuesday. Otherwise, the weather will be cheerful once the fog disappears. Sunshine throughout the day is forecast for the mountain slopes, large areas of North Rhine-Westphalia, and along the edge of the Alps. The temperatures will rise to between 5 and 11 degrees, depending on the amount of sunshine.
draft_translation: On Tuesday, there may be thick fog dissipation in some low-lying areas, with only light clearing of fog or high fog. Otherwise, the weather will be clear after the fog clears. In high areas, in wide parts of NRW, and along the Alps, the sun is expected to shine all day. Temperatures will rise to 5 to 11 degrees Celsius depending on the sunshine.
final_translation: On Tuesday, there may be thick fog clearing in some low-lying areas, with only partial clearing of fog or high fog. Otherwise, the weather will be clear after the fog clears. In high areas, in wide parts of NRW, and along the Alps, the sun is expected to shine all day. Temperatures will rise to 5 to 11 degrees Celsius depending on the amount of sunshine.
